data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A structure serving as a dwelling for one or more persons, especially for a family.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Something, such as a burrow or shell, that serves as a shelter or habitation for a wild animal.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A dwelling for a group of people, such as students or members of a religious community, who live together as a unit.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A building that functions as the primary shelter or location of something.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: a carriage house; the lion house at the zoo.

data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A facility, such as a theater or restaurant, that provides entertainment or food for the public.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: a movie house; the specialty of the house.

data.text: The audience or patrons of such an establishment.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
